required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fertility Preservation in Men Affected by Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Fertility Preservation in Men Affected by Cancer: Assessment of Patients' Needs and Development of an Online Decision-aid

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a single center cross-sectional retrospective study with a quantitative and qualitative approach (phase 1 and 2). In phase 1 an online survey will be realized and targets male cancer survivors. Phase 2 will take a qualitative approach, in which information about patient's experiences, needs and helpful support will be collected by establishing focus groups of cancer patients who had been diagnosed during the reproductive age.
In the end, the results of this study will be integrated into the development of an online support tool concerning Fertility Preservation (FP).

primary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients level of information with regard to FP
primary_outcome.description: Phase 1: exploratory online survey inquiring male cancer patients level of information with regard to FP

primary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients level of information with regard to FP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 focus group meeting (approx. 2 to 4 weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: Phase 2: interview (strictly exploratory) in focus groups collecting data on male cancer patients level of information with regard to FP

secondary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients needs regarding decision-making about FP
secondary_outcome.description: exploratory online survey inquiring which kind of support regarding decision-making about FP do male cancer patients consider helpful

secondary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients expectation with regard to an online DA tool about FP
secondary_outcome.description: exploratory online survey inquiring how an online Decision Aid (DA) tool about FP has to be designed in order to be helpful for male cancer patients

secondary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients needs regarding decision-making about FP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 focus group meeting (approx. 2 to 4 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Phase 2: interview (strictly exploratory) in focus groups evaluating which kind of support regarding decision-making about FP male cancer patients consider helpful

secondary_outcome.measure: male cancer patients expectation with regard to an online DA tool about FP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 focus group meeting (approx. 2 to 4 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Phase 2: interview (strictly exploratory) in focus groups evaluating how an online DA tool about FP has to be designed in order to be helpful for male cancer patients

intervention.description: Part 1: online survey (quantitative) with questions on basic socio-demographic data, medical data and family characteristics (e.g. age, ethnicity, education) and information about FP.

Part 2: At the end of the online survey, participants are invited to attend one of the consecutively performed focus groups conducted according to standardized focus group methodology and moderated by a clinical psychologist and a specialist in reproductive medicine.

study_pop.textblock: Cancer patients who are/were possible candidates for FP (patients with fertility compromising cancer treatment) will be invited to participate. Eligible patients will be approached by their former or current treating oncologist, urologist or specialist in reproductive medicine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- German speaking
- Cancer diagnosis within the last 10 years (minimum age at diagnosis 13 years)
- Cancer therapy that was expected to impair fertility
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prepubertal at diagnosis
